results.name: The forest for the trees
results.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

key_work.title: Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest
key_work.credit_line: Marshmallow Laser Feast in collaboration with Andres Roberts and James Bulley
key_work.brief_description:
Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest is a large-scale video installation that creates a moment of awe, felt when we embrace the presence of a majestic being, a giant Ceiba Pentandra (4°02’06.8 “S70°04’44.1”W) from the Colombian Amazon.
The artwork promotes radical thinking on a new ecology in the age of the Anthropocene.

constellations_primary.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_primary.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

constellations_other.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_other.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

start.title: Ori and the Blind Forest
start.brief_description: The forest of Nibel is dying. After a powerful storm sets a series of devastating events in motion, an unlikely hero must journey to find his courage and confront a dark nemesis to save his home. Ori and the Blind Forest tells the tale of a young orphan destined for heroics, through a visually stunning action-platformer crafted by Moon Studios for Xbox One and PC. Featuring hand-painted artwork, meticulously animated character performance, and a fully orchestrated score, Ori and the Blind Forest explores a deeply emotional story about love and sacrifice, and the hope that exists in us all.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

end.title: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind
end.creator_credit: Hayao Miyazaki, Naoki Kaneko, Shouji Sakai, Tomoko Kida, Isao Takahata, Toshio Suzuki and Topcraft

video_links.name: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind - Official Trailer

end.brief_description: After a global war, the seaside kingdom known as the Valley of the Wind remains one of the last strongholds on Earth untouched by a poisonous jungle and the powerful insects that guard it. Led by the courageous Princess Nausicaä, the people of the Valley engage in an epic struggle to restore the bond between humanity and Earth.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

links.description: The makers of Ori and the Blind Forest were influenced by Hayao Miyazaki. The level “Valley of the Wind” pays homage to Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind. Like Ori, Nausicaä works with the forest and its creatures to save her world.

start.title: FernGully: The Last Rainforest
start.creator_credit: Bill Kroyer, Diana Young, Peter Faiman, Wayne Young, 20th Century Fox, FAI Films, Kroyer Films, Youngheart Productions and Jim Cox
start.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1992
start.brief_description: When a sprite named Crysta shrinks a human boy, Zak, down to her size, he vows to help the magical fairy folk stop a greedy logging company from destroying their home: the pristine rainforest known as FernGully. Zak and his new friends fight to defend FernGully from lumberjacks — and the vengeful spirit they accidentally unleash after chopping down a magic tree.

constellations_other.name: There is no Planet B
constellations_other.description: While the climate emergency is very real, inspiring thousands and thousands of students to strike, documentaries, animated movies and dystopian genre films have warned about a world ravaged by global warming.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

After a powerful storm sets a series of devastating events in motion, an unlikely hero must journey to find his courage and confront a dark nemesis to save his home. Ori and the Blind Forest tells the tale of a young orphan destined for heroics, through a visually stunning action-platformer crafted by Moon Studios for Xbox One and PC. Featuring hand-painted artwork, meticulously animated character performance, and a fully orchestrated score, Ori and the Blind Forest explores a deeply emotional story about love and sacrifice, and the hope that exists in us all.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

links.description: In the videogame Ori and the Blind Forest, Ori has to battle a dark nemesis to save the dying forest. Along the way, Ori works with the light and eyes of the forest’s Spirit Tree, which is similar to the fairies in Fern Gully.

end.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
end.creator_credit: Barrie M. Osborne, Fran Walsh and Peter Jackson
end.headline_credit: New Zealand and United States of America, 2002

video_links.name: The Two Towers | The Lord of the Rings 4K Ultra HD | Warner Bros. Entertainment

end.brief_description: Frodo and Sam trek to Mordor to destroy the One Ring of Power while Gimli, Legolas and Aragorn search for the orc-captured Merry and Pippin. All along, nefarious wizard Saruman awaits the Fellowship members at the Orthanc Tower in Isengard.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

constellations_other.name: Sci-fi miniatures
constellations_other.description: As filmmaking technologies have changed and evolved over the decades, much like audiences, miniatures have endured as one of the most effective film special effects.

links.description: The Lord of the Rings film series features Treebeard, a shepherd of trees created to protect forests from the destruction of the Elves. Treebeard is one of the oldest living things in Middle-earth – like the kopak on our Earth.

start.title: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind
start.creator_credit: Hayao Miyazaki, Naoki Kaneko, Shouji Sakai, Tomoko Kida, Isao Takahata, Toshio Suzuki and Topcraft

video_links.name: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind - Official Trailer

Led by the courageous Princess Nausicaä, the people of the Valley engage in an epic struggle to restore the bond between humanity and Earth.

end.title: Succession
end.creator_credit: Gary Sanchez Productions and Hyperobject Industries
end.brief_description: The lives of the Roy family as they contemplate their future once their aging father begins to step back from the media and entertainment conglomerate they control.

constellations_other.name: Quiet luxury, loud transformations
constellations_other.description: In The Dressmaker, Gertrude (Sarah Snook) transforms from 'dowdy' to elegant when she attends a dance in this dress. It's a popular cinema trope that shows how characters develop, but the 'makeover' trope isn't always a positive.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

constellations_other.name: The spectre of the Romanovs
constellations_other.description: The Romanov dynasty has become a symbol of opulence throughout popular culture. Their final costume ball is even referenced in the coronation mood boards for Tony McNamara's The Great. Let's look at their history on-screen.

links.description: Like Nausicaä, Succession’s “oldest boy” Kendall Roy also takes comfort in nature. So much so, that he builds a giant replica of his childhood treehouse as the VIP area for his 40th birthday.

start.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
start.headline_credit: Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2002
start.brief_description: Cars fly, trees fight back, and a mysterious house-elf comes to warn Harry Potter at the start of his second year at Hogwarts. Adventure and danger await when bloody writing on a wall announces: The Chamber Of Secrets Has Been Opened. To save Hogwarts will require all of Harry, Ron and Hermione’s magical abilities and courage.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

links.description: While some trees can protect themselves, others rely on help. Fern Gully is home to animals and fairies who fight to save their rainforest from loggers and polluters. An animated classic, Fern Gully is a call to action for kids and adults alike.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

links.description: With similarly branch-like arms, the magical Whomping Willow will attack anything within its reach. The tree has taken some damage itself with Harry and Ron crashing a flying Ford Anglia at the start of their second year at Hogwarts.

results.name: Root, branch and vein
results.description: The Tides Within Us are a series of prints appearing in the exhibition Marshmallow Laser Feast: Works of Nature, which were created using medical imagery.

key_work.title: The Tides Within Us print series
key_work.credit_line:
Marshmallow Laser Feast

Co-commissioned by York Mediale with Coventry City of Culture Trust Key scientific collaborator: The Fraunhofer Institute for Digital Medicine MEVIS
key_work.material_description:
Digital prints on Hahnemühle Photo Rag paper
30 x 30
Edition of 5 + 3AP
key_work.brief_description: Where does the living body begin and where does it end? By peering under our skin we reveal the tidal rhythms of oxygen flowing through the branching ecosystem of the human body. Our aim is to challenge notions of boundaries between us and our environment.

constellations_primary.name: Root, branch and vein
constellations_primary.description: The Tides Within Us are a series of prints appearing in the exhibition Marshmallow Laser Feast: Works of Nature, which were created using medical imagery.

start.title: River
start.creator_credit: Jennifer Peedom, Joseph Nizeti, Simon Njoo, Jo-anne McGowan, John Smithson, Arrow Pictures, Dogwoof, River Production Pty Ltd, Stranger Than Fiction Films, Jen Peedom and Robert Macfarlane
start.brief_description: A cinematic and musical odyssey that explores the remarkable relationship between humans and rivers. Throughout history, rivers have shaped our landscapes and our journeys; flowed through our cultures and dreams. RIVER takes its audience on a journey through space and time; spanning six continents, and drawing on extraordinary contemporary cinematography, including satellite filming, the film shows rivers on scales and from perspectives never seen before. Its union of image, music and sparse, the poetic script will create a film that is both dream-like and powerful, honouring the wildness of rivers but also recognizes their vulnerability.

constellations_other.name: Root, branch and vein
constellations_other.description: The Tides Within Us are a series of prints appearing in the exhibition Marshmallow Laser Feast: Works of Nature, which were created using medical imagery.

end.title: The Giants
end.creator_credit: Laurence Billiet, Rachael Antony, Helen Panckhurst, Paul Wiegard and Madman Entertainment
end.brief_description: A portrait of environmental folk hero & gay icon Bob Brown, who took green politics to the center of power. His story is interwoven with the life cycle of the ancient trees he’s fighting for.

constellations_other.name: Root, branch and vein
constellations_other.description: The Tides Within Us are a series of prints appearing in the exhibition Marshmallow Laser Feast: Works of Nature, which were created using medical imagery.

links.description: Both these films use awe-inspiring and inventive images of nature to galvanise viewers to take positive action on climate change.

start.title: De Humani Corporis Fabrica
start.creator_credit: Lucien Castaing-Taylor, Véréna Paravel, Charles Gillibert, Max Karli, Pauline Gygax, Valentina Novati, CG Cinéma, Norte Productions, Rita Productions and S.E.L
start.brief_description: An extraordinary adventure through the interior of the human body; or the discovery of an alien landscape of unprecedented beauty.

constellations_other.name: Root, branch and vein
constellations_other.description: The Tides Within Us are a series of prints appearing in the exhibition Marshmallow Laser Feast: Works of Nature, which were created using medical imagery.

end.title: The Cheese Mites
end.creator_credit: F. Martin Duncan, Charles Urban Trading Company and Micro Bioscope
end.brief_description: A gentleman is here shown partaking of a little lunch of bread and cheese, and occasionally is seen to glance at his morning paper through a reading glass. He suddenly notices that the cheese is a little out of the ordinary, and examines it with his glass. To his horror, he finds it to be alive with mites, and, in disgust, leaves the table. Hundreds of mites resembling crabs are seen scurrying in all directions. A wonderful picture and a subject hitherto unthought of in animated photography. Notable for being the first science film made for the general public.(IMDB)

constellations_other.name: Root, branch and vein
constellations_other.description: The Tides Within Us are a series of prints appearing in the exhibition Marshmallow Laser Feast: Works of Nature, which were created using medical imagery.

links.description: Each advancement in camera technology reveals the world to us in new ways. One of the first was a silent film called The Cheese Mites from 1903, which horrified and fascinated audiences as microscopic lifeforms were made visible on the big screen.

start.title: The Tides Within Us print series
start.credit_line:
Marshmallow Laser Feast

30 x 30
Edition of 5 + 3AP

constellations_primary.name: Root, branch and vein
constellations_primary.description: The Tides Within Us are a series of prints appearing in the exhibition Marshmallow Laser Feast: Works of Nature, which were created using medical imagery.

end.creator_credit: Lucien Castaing-Taylor, Véréna Paravel, Charles Gillibert, Max Karli, Pauline Gygax, Valentina Novati, CG Cinéma, Norte Productions, Rita Productions and S.E.L
end.brief_description: An extraordinary adventure through the interior of the human body; or the discovery of an alien landscape of unprecedented beauty.

constellations_other.name: Root, branch and vein
constellations_other.description: The Tides Within Us are a series of prints appearing in the exhibition Marshmallow Laser Feast: Works of Nature, which were created using medical imagery.

links.description: Medical imagery used to create the detailed prints The Tides Within Us also features in this documentary set in the French hospital system. Tiny cameras capture incredible detail of surgical procedures inside the body, but also the pulsing human ecosystem of doctors, nurses and patients.

start.title: The Giants
start.creator_credit: Laurence Billiet, Rachael Antony, Helen Panckhurst, Paul Wiegard and Madman Entertainment
start.brief_description: A portrait of environmental folk hero & gay icon Bob Brown, who took green politics to the center of power. His story is interwoven with the life cycle of the ancient trees he’s fighting for.

constellations_other.name: Root, branch and vein
constellations_other.description: The Tides Within Us are a series of prints appearing in the exhibition Marshmallow Laser Feast: Works of Nature, which were created using medical imagery.

end.title: Terra Nil
end.brief_description: Terra Nil is an intricate environmental strategy game about transforming a barren wasteland into a thriving, balanced ecosystem. Bring life back to a lifeless world by purifying soil, cleaning oceans, planting trees, and reintroducing wildlife, then leave without a trace.

constellations_other.name: Root, branch and vein
constellations_other.description: The Tides Within Us are a series of prints appearing in the exhibition Marshmallow Laser Feast: Works of Nature, which were created using medical imagery.

links.description: The Giants focuses on the life and work of Tasmanian environmentalist Bob Brown. In Terra Nil players take on the challenges and rewards of transforming and rewilding landscapes.

start.title: The Tides Within Us print series
start.credit_line:
Marshmallow Laser Feast

Co-commissioned by York Mediale with Coventry City of Culture Trust Key scientific collaborator: The Fraunhofer Institute for Digital Medicine MEVIS

end.title: River
end.creator_credit: Jennifer Peedom, Joseph Nizeti, Simon Njoo, Jo-anne McGowan, John Smithson, Arrow Pictures, Dogwoof, River Production Pty Ltd, Stranger Than Fiction Films, Jen Peedom and Robert Macfarlane
end.brief_description: A cinematic and musical odyssey that explores the remarkable relationship between humans and rivers. Throughout history, rivers have shaped our landscapes and our journeys; flowed through our cultures and dreams. RIVER takes its audience on a journey through space and time; spanning six continents, and drawing on extraordinary contemporary cinematography, including satellite filming, the film shows rivers on scales and from perspectives never seen before. Its union of image, music and sparse, the poetic script will create a film that is both dream-like and powerful, honouring the wildness of rivers but also recognizes their vulnerability.

constellations_other.name: Root, branch and vein
constellations_other.description: The Tides Within Us are a series of prints appearing in the exhibition Marshmallow Laser Feast: Works of Nature, which were created using medical imagery.

links.description: Medical imagery reveals the branching structure of veins that carry blood within our bodies, just as aerial footage captures similar patterns of water flowing in the river structures that nourish our planet.
